Mikado.serializers.blast_serializer package¶

Mikado.serializers.blast_serializer.hit module¶

This module implements the Hit serialisation class.

class Mikado.serializers.blast_serializer.hit.Hit(query_id, target_id, alignment, evalue, bits, hit_number=1, query_multiplier=1, target_multiplier=1)[source]¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Base

This class is used to serialise and store in a DB a BLAST hit. Stored attributes:

  • id Indexing key
  • query_id Foreign ID key for the query table
  • target_id Foreign ID key for the target table
  • qt_constrating

Mikado.serializers.blast_serializer.hsp module¶

This module implements the HSP serialisation class.

class Mikado.serializers.blast_serializer.hsp.Hsp(hsp, counter, query_id, target_id)[source]¶

Bases: sqlalchemy.ext.declarative.api.Base

This class serializes and stores into the DB the various HSPs. It is directly connected to the Hit table, through the “hit_id” reference key. The Hit reference can be accessed through the hit_object attribute; back-reference (Hit to Hsps) is given by the “hsps” attribute.

Keys:

Return hit_id:Reference key for the Hit table
Rtype hit_id:int
Return counter:It indicates the progressive number of the HSP for the hit
Rtype counter:int
Return query_hsp_start:
 Start position on the query

:rtype query_hsp_start; int

Return query_hsp_end:
 End position on the query
Rtype query_hsp_end:
 int
Return target_hsp_start:
 Start position on the target
Rtype target_hsp_start:
 int
Return target_hsp_end:
 End position on the target
Rtype target_hsp_end:
 int
Return hsp_evalue:
 Evalue of the HSP
Rtype hsp_evalue:
 float
Return hsp_bits:
 Bit-score of the HSP
Rtype hsp_bits:float
Return hsp_identity:
 Identity (in %) of the alignment
Rtype hsp_identity:
 float
Return hsp_length:
 Length of the HSP
Rtype hsp_length:
 int
Return match:the match line between query and target, with the following specs: - If the position is a match/positive, keep the original value - If the position is a gap for the query, insert a - (dash) - If the position is a gap for the target, insert a _ (underscore) - If the position is a gap for both, insert a (backslash)

An HSP row has the following constraints: - Counter,hit_id must be unique (and are primary keys) - The combination (“Hit_id”,”query_hsp_start”,”query_hsp_end”, “target_hsp_start”, “target_hsp_end”) must be unique

Moreover, the following properties are also present:

Return query_object:
 The referenced Query
Rtype query_object:
 Query
Return target_object:
 The reference Target
Rtype target_object:
 Target
as_dict()[source]¶

Method to return a dict representation of the object. Necessary for storing. This method returns a dictionary without any attribute that requires joined data. It is meant to be used only by the method as_dict of the Hit class.

classmethod as_dict_static(state_obj)[source]¶

Method to return a dict representation of the object. Necessary for storing. This method returns a dictionary without any attribute that requires joined data. As a static method, it is useful to be used outside of the class. :param state_obj: an instance of the HSP class or a collections.namedtuple object from a direct query

:rtype : dict

as_full_dict()[source]¶

Method to return a dict representation of the object. This method also checks query name and hit name, so it is slower than as_dict and used when it is necessary to retrieve data independently from Hit.

Mikado.serializers.blast_serializer.target module¶

This module implements a very simple class for serialising the BLAST targets into a table containing numeric ID, name and length.

Mikado.serializers.blast_serializer.utils module¶

Generic utilities used for BLAST serialising into a DB.

exception Mikado.serializers.blast_serializer.utils.InvalidHit[source]¶

Bases: ValueError

Mikado.serializers.blast_serializer.utils.prepare_hit(hit, query_id, target_id, **kwargs)[source]¶

Prepare the dictionary for fast loading of Hit and Hsp objects. global_positives: the similarity rate for the global hit using the query perspective global_identity: the identity rate for the global hit using the query perspective

Parameters:
  • hit (Bio.Blast.Record.Alignment) – the hit to parse.
  • query_id (int) – the numeric ID of the query in the database. Necessary for serialisation.
  • target_id (int) – the numeric ID of the target in the database. Necessary for serialisation.
  • kwargs (dict) – additional properties to give to the hit_dict. Retrieved e.g. from descriptions.
Mikado.serializers.blast_serializer.utils.prepare_hsp(hsp, counter)[source]¶

Prepare a HSP for loading into the DB. The match line will be reworked in the following way:

  • If the position is a match/positive, keep the original value
  • If the position is a gap for the query, insert a - (dash)
  • If the position is a gap for the target, insert a _ (underscore)
  • If the position is a gap for both, insert a (backslash)
Parameters:
  • hsp (Bio.Blast.Record.HSP) – An HSP object from Bio.Blast.NCBIXML
  • counter – a digit that indicates the priority of the HSP in the hit
Returns:

hsp_dict, identical_positions, positives
Return type:

(dict, set, set)

Mikado.serializers.blast_serializer.xml_serialiser module¶

XML serialisation class.

class Mikado.serializers.blast_serializer.xml_serialiser.XmlSerializer(xml, logger=None, json_conf=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

This class has the role of taking in input a blast XML file and (partially) serialise it into a database. We are using SQLalchemy, so the database type could be any of SQLite, MySQL, PSQL, etc.

load_into_db(objects)[source]¶
Parameters:objects (list) – Objects to be loaded into the database

Method to perform the bulk loading of objects into the SQL database.

logger = <logging.Logger object>¶
serialize()[source]¶

Method to serialize the BLAST XML file into a database provided with the __init__ method

Module contents¶

This package contains all the modules necessary for BLAST serialisation and analysis.
